intro: Millettia angustidentata, commonly known as the narrow-toothed millettia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including countries such as India, China, and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with narrow, serrated leaflets and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces pod-like fruits that contain several small, edible seeds. Millettia angustidentata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
